items.content:
Kubernetes Solutions Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Giant Swarm GmbH | Cologne, Germany

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Cologne, Germany. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

kubernetes
containers
microservices

Job description

We are looking for a Kubernetes Solution Architect

You are the voice of the customer inside Giant Swarm and the voice of Giant Swarm towards the customers, helping both sides to be successful.

Your Job:

  • You work closely with customers to understand their architecture and further their understanding of Giant Swarm, helping them to get the most out of our product and the CNCF landscape, master Cloud Native tools like Kubernetes, Prometheus as well as Loki, Helm and others.
  • Our solution architects are becoming part of diverse open source communities around tools that our customers need and use, contributing back to those projects where possible. You build and maintain helm charts that might start out as a special project for one customer and end up being a managed service run by all our customers.
  • You hold trainings and workshops at conferences, for our existing customers, as well as with Giant Swarm’s potential customers. .  Do note that the role requires minimum travel as most of our interactions as a fully remote company are via video conferencing.

  • Learn from customer's problems with moving to microservices architectures, get your hands dirty and find out what Cloud Native project's entrails look like. The more successful our customers are with the Cloud Native journey, the more successful we are.
  • Ultimately, you are also responsible for documentation, helping the product teams implement fixes, prioritizing features and making sure we only need to answer questions once.

  • First impressions are important! You help create a great onboarding experience for our customers and become the main point of contact for them.
  • To sum it up: Customer Success is all that matters. Within the solution engineering team, we make sure our customers are happy and taking the right steps going forward, at best you anticipate the problems they might face in the future.

Requirements:

  • You have experience with more than one programming language, including Go, and a strong architectural background.
  • You feel at home in the Kubernetes world, especially the multitude of Open Source tools around Kubernetes and the Container World.
  • You can explain complicated things concisely and easily for a diverse audience.
  • You have a strong sense in providing an awesome customer service that makes life easier for Developers. Your communication skills (especially written form) are excellent. Very good English skills are a must-have. German skills are a bonus.
  • You are open to attend conferences with our team and hold talks in front of customers. You are happy to travel 5-10% per year
  • We (and our customers) are currently mostly distributed around Europe (around UTC), thus, your main timezone should be somewhere between -2UTC to +2UTC to ensure better communication.

Why we think this position is worth applying for (challenge us!)

  • Impact, Impact, Impact! We are a growing team (from 15+ European countries) and every new team member changes the team. This is great! People who know things we don’t are highly welcome.
  • “It's better to ask forgiveness than permission” (Paolini) - sure, it’s not 100% like this, but we have a strong culture of failure which is part of our agile mindset. We don’t do things like in the guidebook. Hell, our customers choose us because we are building how the guidebook should look in this day and age. You can try things out.
  • We play a key role in our customer's digital transformation. We have partnered up with Amazon Web Services and Microsoft to provide our solution on their cloud platforms - more will follow.
  • We serve some of Europe's leading organisations and are talking to many more.

About Giant Swarm GmbH

What is it like to work at Giant Swarm?

We would like to give you a glimpse on how working with Giant Swarm (we are a fully remote team) is like:

Self-organization

Creative work needs freedom and openness. We encourage you to do your work wherever (some of us travel almost half the year and work from remote islands) and whenever you want (keeping in mind that there are some meetings we would like you to attend). We expect passion and encourage sustainability. If you need rest, take it. If you take up a task, own it. If you see a problem, solve it.

Teamwork

We are a growing company with team members distributed all over Europe and plans on expanding to the US. Our ambitious goals are only achievable as a team. Everybody’s input is highly welcome and appreciated. Although sometimes rules and processes are necessary, we try to keep them as lean as possible. Always question the status quo and find new ways of collaboration and team work.

Learning

Learning is mandatory and fun at the same time. If you realise you want to expand your knowledge in a specific area, we support you with conferences, books etc.

Basics

We offer fair (transparent and open) salaries with benefits like choosing your own laptop, your choice to work at home or in a coworking space, flexible hours, minimal meetings, transparent communication, etc.. And you will participate in our stock options program. Currently our team members have more children than we are employees. So family friendliness is a must.

We don't hire job descriptions. We hire humans. :)

We welcome applications from everybody, regardless ethnic or national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation or age.

Interested? Questions? Contact Larissa or apply directly.

Apply now

Benefits

  • unlimited holidays
  • fair and transparent open salaries
  • familiy friendlyness is a must
  • choose the time you want to work
  • choose the devices you want to work with
  • remote work possible

items.content:
Developer Advocate

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: DevOps
Industry: Agile Software Development, Software Development / Engineering, Technology Consulting
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: YLD | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+00:00) London

Technologies

open-source
javascript
devops
testing

Job description

Overview

Everything we do empowers our clients to move forward.

Great technology companies are built on incredible design, engineering and strategy, working in unison, operating at the very heart of an organisation and its audience. Enabling organisations to become great technology companies is our mission and our promise to our clients.

We aim to leave them with the mindset, tools, skills and expertise they need to go beyond their own expectations, revolutionise their sectors, and for us to be proud of the change we create with them and their customers.

About YLD

“Good enough to be dangerous”

During our company-wide trip to Porto, our CEO Nuno attributed YLD’s continued growth and success down to those we hire.

Our employees are “good enough to be dangerous” and we believe that bringing extraordinary people together produces great results.

We are a strong proponent of continuous delivery and rigorous testing practices, and we help our customers move towards modern best-practices with minimal risk.

We educate, co-develop and automate, whilst passing on our expertise to our customers’ development teams in the process. It’s not just about lines of code.

YLD has offices in London, Manchester, Lisbon, Porto.

About The Role

A YLD Developer Advocate is first and foremost an engineer, so you will need to be specialised on a particular technology. You will also have experience engaging with the community, public speaking and developer relations.

Our tech conferences and meetups are built by the community, for the community. Your role will be leading the innovation of our community engagement with open-source work. We expect a Developer Advocate to work closely with the CTO and Head of Marketing to engage open source communities and tell the YLD story.

This role helps keep us connected to the communities that love technology as much as we do!

About You

You will act as a passionate advocate within the community as well as being a vocal champion for developer interests within YLD.  

You will be an engineer that loves to connect with developers - you enjoy speaking publicly about open-source technologies at conferences, meetups and sharing your knowledge through varying content forms. 

You’ll bring an entrepreneurial flair,  as you will build and maintain networks with other engineers and decision-making leaders.  

You possess excellent communication skills that will allow you to build clear and compelling presentations and deliver them to a variety of audiences. 

Your Responsibilities

Engineering

  • Open Source work - Be active in the open source world, own open source projects that impact the community and participate in relevant open source projects by opening issues, commenting on existing issues, submitting pull requests, etc;
  • Software Development - Build tooling / extensions for the technologies we use, find ways to improve the engineers’ workflows and talk / write about it;
  • Research - Proactively seeking new technologies, building prototypes, and writing about the experience, which will inform YLD of potential new business areas  to explore;
  • Training - Be a leader and an expert in a given technology, write content that can be used in a business context for a client or internally for our engineers to help their professional growth;
  • Sales Engineering - Being able to clearly articulate the benefits of a particular technology in the context of a client engagement, provide workshops to clients and be able to prove to clients the value of using a given technology

Marketing / Community

  • Community engagement - Work closely with the marketing team to represent YLD within our community via education such as talks or workshops at conferences and meetups, events organisation, and content creation;
  • Knowledge sharing - Lead content creation on the core YLD technologies via blogs, white papers, webinars, videos as well as exploring new channels and technologies;
  • Documentation - Work on training materials and identifying ways to document how we utilise open-source technologies;
  • Educating the internal teams - Bring back the knowledge from the industry and community events by presenting new trends and working with the team to implement new ways of working and community engagement

Our Offer

  • 6 month pay reviews
  • 6 months fully paid maternity and paternity leave
  • £2,000 yearly allowance for training / conferences
  • £300 hardware budget
  • Minimum of 25 days holiday (excluding Public Holidays)
  • Mentorship through fortnightly 1:1s
  • Company pension
  • Private health care
  • Company Uber and Airbnb account for business travel
  • Cycle to work scheme

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply now

Benefits

  • Flexible hours
  • Minimum of 25 days holiday
  • 6 months fully paid Maternity / Paternity leave
  • Free lunch on Fridays / weekly Retro
  • Opportunity to attend / speak at multiple events
  • £2000 yearly training and conference allowance
  • Fun, challenging and rewarding work environment
  • Possibility to travel! (Annual company trip)
  • Medical insurance (Bupa)
  • Offices in London, Lisbon, Porto and Manchester

items.content:
Magnolia Solution Architect (German-Speaking)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer, Full Stack Developer
Industry: Agile Software Development, Enterprise Software, Marketing Software
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Magnolia International Ltd. | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin

Technologies

java
glassfish
unix
jboss
http

Job description

“We believe in making it as easy and fast as possible for smart, digitally experienced brands to deliver great web projects and amazing customer experiences…and we love doing it!” Tim Brown, CEO, Magnolia

Sounds like you? Great, here’s how Magnolia empowers your success:

  • A Great Product:  Loved by clients and respected by analysts, Magnolia is arguably one of the best CMS solutions on the market.
  • Directly Contribute to Magnolia’s Success: We value each individuals’ input and create opportunities to realize them.
  • Great variety in your areas of responsibility: You will be able to dive into any skill area within the company that allows you to grow according to your personal career goals.
  • International Exposure: With offices in the USA, Spain, Switzerland, Czech Republic, Singapore, and Vietnam you will collaborate with colleagues from over 30 Nationalities.



Now, if you are an experienced Solution Architect who wants to support our business growth in the DACH region, please read on.

 What we need you to do

  • Provide value during product demonstrations by showcasing Magnolia features and capabilities during initial product evaluations.
  • Define requirements and develop measurement strategies to ensure the Magnolia solution addresses the customers’ specific business needs. 
  • Provide expert know-how on development, integration and Magnolia deployment and system architecture, including backup strategies, load balancing, failover, security, multisite and general hosting configuration.
  • Consult with existing clients to expand their usage of Magnolia or troubleshoot issues encountered.
  • Build proof of concept and new modules, trace issues in client implementations and propose solutions to maximize the business value to our customers.
  • Work constantly with cutting-edge technology to help customers to reach their demanding goals in the area of digital transformation.

What you ideally offer

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field is required
  • Fluent in German (at least C1)
  • +5 years of experience in software development, building or managing the development of a complex, commercial enterprise-class product. Experience with cloud-based installations and web services is a big plus.
  • Proficiency with web development skills
  • Proven software engineering skills in Java.
  • Experience with a broad range of operating systems, application servers, databases, and related products (e.g. Unix, Solaris, OSX, Windows; WebSphere, WebLogic, Glassfish, Tomcat, JBoss; Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server etc.).
  • Experience in Internet technologies: HTTP, HTML, XML, Web server, server-side Java, and databases.
  • Excellent problem solving and communication skills.
  • A strong commitment to timelines and deliverables.
  • Willing and able to travel regularly within Europe.
  • A collaborative can-do attitude and a relentless focus on helping our customers succeed.
Apply now

About Magnolia International Ltd.

Why work at Magnolia

Magnolia is an exciting place to work, where good team dynamics are valued and where you will be encouraged to pursue your own growth. Get to know us better by browsing our employee blog or checking our current job openings.

We develop the best web content management system, an interesting, high-quality product, have big customers, work with friendly people in a relaxed environment, and be well compensated - that's what developing at Magnolia is about

Get the insider view of working at Magnolia here.

Our product blurb:
Magnolia CMS delivers smartphone simplicity, on an enterprise scale. The mobile-inspired user interface works through customizable, task-focused Apps, a notification stream called the Pulse, and a system of Favorites for quickly accessing the workspace.
Magnolia is used in more than 100 countries across the world, by governments and leading FORTUNE 500 enterprises.

If you want to see more of how we spend our time as Magnolians, both in the office and on outings, check out our albums on Flickr.

Benefits

  • We love Apple - you get what you need
  • Competitive compensation
  • 25 days paid vacation
  • Freedom and responsibility in your work
  • Low admin bureaucracy in a self driven environment
  • Endless snacks, catering, free drinks, happy hours, BBQs etc...
  • Responsible self-management
  • Home- / Remote friendly company
  • No dress code, relaxed atmosphere

items.content:
Principal Cloud Architect

London / Remote

£80,000-90,000 + Bonus

Our client is a large IT consultancy who specialise in designing, delivering and managing complex infrastructure and cloud solutions to mid-market and enterprise clients.

Due to very strong growth in pipeline they are now looking to recruit a Principal Cloud Architect (Azure) into the team in Central London. The role will see you working within the Technology Solutions division, working very closely alongside the Professional Services team.

Key Responsibilities

  • Engaging with the organisations clients in scoping, discovering and defining solutions that meet clients' business, technical and service objectives.
  • Be part of the virtual team that leads on ongoing client engagements.
  • Work with the sales and client management team on bids/opportunities.
  • Provide insight to clients and be their trusted advisor (including challenging their current thinking).
  • Provide technical appraisal of what can be achieved for the client.
  • Creation of innovative solution designs both technical and service solutions, utilising the extensive range of service offerings and possibly bespoke client specific services.
  • Creation of costs for technical and service solution within a purpose written product driven toolset.
  • Provide where necessary explanations and presentations of the organisations services and technical product offerings to clients.
  • Facilitate input from appropriate departments i.e. product & service development teams, sales, service management, bid management to assess viability and risk of solutions.
  • Initiate and collaborate with other consulting specialists and Subject Matter Experts.
  • Own the solution design integrity throughout the entire lifecycle of the Client Solution.
  • Production of Indicative technical proposals and Solution Documents.
  • Input into RFIs, ITTs, RFP's, RFQs etc.

Required Knowledge

  • Significant experience in designing solutions based on Azure public cloud, including:
  • IaaS
  • PaaS (App Service Environment, Azure SQL)
  • Server-less (Functions, Containers, Service Fabric)
  • Azure Monitor and Azure Security Center
  • Experience in designing solutions that incorporate many of the following technologies:
  • Operating Systems, Microsoft Windows, Red-hat Linux
  • Next Gen and Web Application Firewalls
  • Microsoft SQL Server
  • Hybrid cloud
  • Understanding of Azure ExpressRoute
  • Understanding of LAN and WAN high level networking
  • HA & DR solutions
  • A strong understanding of the challenges faced when migrating IT Services

Desirable Knowledge

  • Experience of an ITIL based framework
  • TOGAF framework
  • Understanding of developing technologies/methodologies (Automation, Dev Ops, AI)
  • SAP on Azure
  • Citrix on Azure (Citrix Cloud and IaaS)
  • Office 365

Skills

  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in front of senior clients
  • Excellent understanding and experience of coordinating senior level presentations
  • Excellent organisation and planning
  • Problem analysis and problem-solving
  • Persuasive negotiation skills
  • Adaptability & creativity
  • Sound judgment & decision-making
  • Client focused and collaborative
  • Detail orientated
  • Persistent & resourceful

items.content:
Solution Consultant - UK (Remote)

Salary - £80,000

Location - Remote

Job Description

Are you passionate about Master Data Management across Industries in the European marketplace? Do you have a talent for communicating solution selling in an engaging manner which brings results? Would you like to join a European Professional Services team in an international software company, which is focused and ambitious in ensuring software implementation projects with a business first mindset with both new and existing customers? Then please carry on reading…


Our clients primary objective is to manage and advise on master data management solutions - from qualification of requirements all the way through the delivery and implementation of our software related to the companies Systems' Master Data Management platform. You will be working with medium to large organizations and liaise with people at all organisational levels as well as supporting our partners during the implementation projects. Internally you will liaise with the Technology Consulting team as well as the Sales Support team.

This role reports to Managing Consultant Implementation Services and is based in UK.

Objectives and responsibilities:


You will have a broad interface and engagement internally within the company as well as externally in relation to customers and partners.

Your primary objectives are as follows:
- You will represent the company in a consultancy role in relation to assigned implementation projects
- You will ensure quality of deliverables remains in line with agreed standards, within scope and budget
- You will liaise throughout project lifecycle with relevant project stakeholders to define final solution design
- You will analyze customer business needs and data needs and propose appropriate STEP configuration solutions
- You will configure the STEP application in line with the documented solution design
- You will design and implement business solutions jointly bringing added value to the customer
- You will perform problem analysis and resolution activities

- You will actively participate and contribute to customer project meetings
- You will support our partners during implementation projects
- Depending on the duties performed, extensive travel should be expected, primarily within the European region.

Core professional skills and personal competencies:


- The ideal candidate has vast experience in defining and implementing MDM or ERP solutions, ideally within an international organisation.
- The role would suit either an experienced Solution Consultant or candidate with experience of working in a Lead Consultant role on either MDM or ERP software implementation projects.
- Finally, you have strong communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written, enabling you to command and attract attention - make people listen.

Required:
- Proven experience within the software industry - preferably within Master Data Management and/or Information Management
- Proven advanced skills in one or more of the following areas: e-commerce solutions, Retail IT solutions, Product Information Management (PIM), Master Data Management (MDM), ERP, CRM, BI technologies
- You are customer focused and constantly driven by adding value to the stakeholder experience
- You are able to focus and drive results both as a team player as well as an individual.
- You have a positive attitude and pro-active approach focussed on options and opportunities: The Art Of The Possible
- You are flexible, able and willing to go the extra mile to achieve results and obtain stakeholder satisfaction.
- Experience of working with partners/IT System Integrators is an advantage
- English business language proficiency is required

items.title: Azure Stack Cloud Solutions Architect-Remote (SR1157)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=16, frontend=0}
items.content:
Description

SAIC is hiring for an Azure or Azure Stack Cloud Solutions Architect to join and contribute to the Private Cloud team. This position is a combination of IT architecture and automation roles.

The Cloud department provides public and private cloud services, automation services, and tools to enable self service delivery of IT using the DevOps framework. This department will constantly evolve to meet the rapid pace of cloud innovation.



The successful candidate will have the following responsibilities:

  • Performs the full lifecycle management (analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, integration and maintenance) of the current Azure Stack cloud as well as contribute with architecture, procurement, deployment, production, and administration of additional scale units, availability zones, and disconnected deployments of Azure Stack.
  • Maintains the integrity of the stack and underlying systems and resource providers.
  • Build and maintain terraform Infrastructure as Code packages for cloud deployments. Build and maintain custom ARM templates.
  • Build and maintained CI/CD pipelines for IaaS deployments including such architectures as basic two-tier configurations to multi-node Horton Works Data Platform clusters.

items.title: Lead Cisco Wireless Solutions Engineer (REMOTE w/ Travel)
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Cisco R/S, Cisco Wireless Suite, CCIE, CCNP, CWNP, Cisco ISE, Prime/NCS/WCS

Award winning Technology Solutions provider & Cisco Gold Partner has an immediate need for a remote based Cisco Wireless Solutions Engineer. This is a national role where you will be covering clients to provide Cisco Infrastructure, Wireless and Security solutions. Great growth opportunity and chance to work with an elite team of Engineers.

****Highly qualified candidates will be offered the opportunity to work remote!

Top Reasons to Work with Us

*** Excellent growth opportunities
*** Very competitive comp plans offered
*** Ability to work remotely from home when not in front of clients

What You Need for this Position

- Ability to provide both Pre & Post Sales Solutions Engineering
- CCIE Wireless OR CCNP Wireless Certification
- 3-5+ years of hands-on experience in Wireless Engineering
- 3-5+ years of experience in Cisco R/S Engineering
- In depth knowledge of Cisco Wireless Suite and 802.11 family of protocols
- Prime/NCS/WCS experience
- CCIE is highly desired along with CCNP and / or CCNP-Wireless certifications
- CWNP certifications a plus (CWNE, CWDP, CWSP, CWAP, CWNA)
- Any experience with other Cisco Advanced Technologies (Security, IPT, & video) is a plus.
- Experience with Aruba wireless engineering is a plus
- Experience with Cisco ISE is a big plus

What You Will Be Doing

- Specializing in Wireless and Network solutions for mid-enterprise clients
- Designing and implementing enterprise grade wireless networks
- Troubleshooting and resolving network, wireless, and communications issues
- Implementation and troubleshooting WCS/NCS/Cisco Prime Infrastructures
- Cisco ISE Deployment & Engineering if desired
- Interfacing with c-level decision maker's at enterprise, financial services and / or healthcare clients throughout the region.
- Acting as a mentor to other engineers on the team

What's In It for You

- Opportunity to work for a recognized Cisco Gold Partner that values collaboration and an entrepreneurial spirit
- Competitive base salary, bonuses, full benefits, 401K and vacation time.
- Paid training in additional Cisco Advanced Technologies (Security, IPT, Video, etc.)Please apply today or you can send your resume to me directly at:

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

items.title: Principal Solutions Architect
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=0, dotnet=24, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=13, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Principal Solutions Architect

United States, Georgia
Company: Fiserv

Overview

What does an excellent Principal Solutions Architect do?

A Principal Solutions Architect (Principal SA) is the relationship manager for architectural engagements with an assigned business unit-s technology team. You will hold and participate in road mapping sessions, -what-if- design theories, prioritization of work, contribute to technology debt management, and assist in annual and long-range business unit technology planning. You can expect to advocate technical architecture and build consensus for the adoption of new technologies across multiple functional teams.

As part of the relationship with the business unit technology team, you will act as a liaison between any new technologies the business unit may be investigating and the platform teams that own that type of technology. You-ll work with those platform teams, the Technology Design leaders, and various committees in the enterprise to enable the adoption of new technologies to meet business needs.

You partner with internal product groups and engineering teams to develop technical designs for top priority and complex needs, while advocating alignment with enterprise standards. You’ll collaborate with Development, Product, Engineering, and Architecture teams to provide the right level of agility within a defined delivery process.

As a Principal SA, you are part of the Technology Design chain. This means that you will be mentoring other Solutions Architects and Business Analysis to further the capabilities of those individuals and build a stronger team. You-ll also provide 2nd tier architecture support for projects; if there are execution questions on any designs, they will be escalated up through the chain to you if deep inspection is needed.

In addition to future looking designs, you-ll also be responsible for conducting deep analysis of current environments and projects and providing detailed write-ups and recommendations to business presidents and C-level leadership.

We are a high energy, highly driven, and highly collaborative team. If this sounds like a good fit for your skill set, we-re looking for you!

Basic qualifications for consideration:

  • High School Diploma and 10+ years of relevant work experience
  • 6+ years of experience designing and building enterprise class distributed systems.
  • 6+ years’ experience in the financial services industry or other highly regulated industries.
  • 6+ years of indirect or direct technical leadership.
  • Expert level skill in the Microsoft Office suite, including Word, Visio, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  • Expert in collaboration with co-workers and subject matter experts that may be in remote locations.
  • Highly organized and able to work multiple efforts simultaneously.
  • Excellent written communication skills, including the use and creation of slide presentations and drawings.
  • High level of public speaking skills, presenting designs to groups of peers and business unit leadership and C-level leadership.
  • Experience interacting with customers a to analyze, validate, specify, verify, document and lead solution requirements.
  • Experience with .NET/Java development, private and public cloud environments (AWS/Azure/Google Cloud), and Automation/Continuous Integration (Salt, Fabric, Jenkins, Octopus Deploy, etc.)
  • Experience in SDLC including associated deployment methodologies, QA processes, and performance tuning.
  • Previous Infrastructure/System Engineering experience in heterogeneous environments.
  • Expert level technical skill in at least one of these: Windows, Linux, Storage, Networking and/or Security.
  • Recent experience leading the technical design of high transaction volume distributed systems or other complex projects.
  • Ability to travel up to 20%.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor-s Degree in Computer Science or related technical field
  • Master’s degree
  • Architect level certifications for Windows, Linux, Storage, Networking, or Security.
  • Experience with TOGAF or other architecture frameworks.

Learn more about Fiserv:

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren-t thinking about -financial services- But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We-re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company-s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE- 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World-s Most Admired Companies for the sixth consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an equal opportunity employer/disability/vet

Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

items.content:
Description

SAIC is hiring for an Azure or Azure Stack Cloud Solutions Architect to join and contribute to the Private Cloud team. This position is a combination of IT architecture and automation roles.

The Cloud department provides public and private cloud services, automation services, and tools to enable self service delivery of IT using the DevOps framework. This department will constantly evolve to meet the rapid pace of cloud innovation.



The successful candidate will have the following responsibilities:

  • Performs the full lifecycle management (analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, integration and maintenance) of the current Azure Stack cloud as well as contribute with architecture, procurement, deployment, production, and administration of additional scale units, availability zones, and disconnected deployments of Azure Stack.
  • Maintains the integrity of the stack and underlying systems and resource providers.
  • Build and maintain terraform Infrastructure as Code packages for cloud deployments. Build and maintain custom ARM templates.
  • Build and maintained CI/CD pipelines for IaaS deployments including such architectures as basic two-tier configurations to multi-node Horton Works Data Platform clusters.
  • Build Ansible playbooks for controlled IaaS systems.
  • Build complex powershell scripts to automate any number of configurations and scenarios.

The selected candidate must be able to solve new and complex problems involving the integration of a wide variety of technologies including servers, storage, networking, software, middleware and all systems supporting the private cloud environments. The selected candidate can work at a remote location but will be required to travel to Albuquerque throughout the year.


DISL

ABQS







Qualifications

Required Skills

  • Requires bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or information systems and 5 years of relevant work experience OR 9 years of relevant work experience in lieu of degree; Or Master's degree and 3 years of relevant work experience; OR PhD and no related experience.
  • Excellent communication and teaming skills.
  • Ability to obtain, and maintain, a DOE security clearance
  • Minimum of 2 years using one of the following technologies:
    • Azure
    • Azure Stack
    • AWS
    • Ansible
    • Terraform



Desired Skills

  • Experience building Azure Arm Templates
  • Experience building terraform packages
  • Experience with Gitlab Ci/CD
  • Windows Systems Administration (Windows 2012R2, 2016, 2019)
  • Linux Systems Administration (Ubuntu, RHEL)
  • Advanced PowerShell scripting
  • Microsoft Azure Certifications



Desired Qualifications

items.title: Lead Cisco Wireless Solutions Engineer (Remote w/ Travel)
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Cisco R/S, Cisco Wireless Suite, CCIE, CCNP, CWNP, Cisco ISE, Prime/NCS/WCS

Award winning Technology Solutions provider & Cisco Gold Partner has an immediate need for a remote based Cisco Wireless Solutions Engineer. This is a national role where you will be covering clients to provide Cisco Infrastructure, Wireless and Security solutions. Great growth opportunity and chance to work with an elite team of Engineers.

****Highly qualified candidates will be offered the opportunity to work remote from home when not in front of clients.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

*** Excellent growth opportunities
*** Very competitive comp plans offered
*** Ability to work remotely from home when not in front of clients

What You Need for this Position

- Ability to provide both Pre & Post Sales Solutions Engineering
- CCIE Wireless OR CCNP Wireless Certification
- 3-5+ years of hands-on experience in Wireless Engineering
- 3-5+ years of experience in Cisco R/S Engineering
- In depth knowledge of Cisco Wireless Suite and 802.11 family of protocols
- Prime/NCS/WCS experience
- CCIE is highly desired along with CCNP and / or CCNP-Wireless certifications
- CWNP certifications a plus (CWNE, CWDP, CWSP, CWAP, CWNA)
- Any experience with other Cisco Advanced Technologies (Security, IPT, & video) is a plus.
- Experience with Aruba wireless engineering is a plus
- Experience with Cisco ISE is a big plus

What You Will Be Doing

- Specializing in Wireless and Network solutions for mid-enterprise clients
- Designing and implementing enterprise grade wireless networks
- Troubleshooting and resolving network, wireless, and communications issues
- Implementation and troubleshooting WCS/NCS/Cisco Prime Infrastructures
- Cisco ISE Deployment & Engineering if desired
- Interfacing with c-level decision maker's at enterprise, financial services and / or healthcare clients throughout the region.
- Acting as a mentor to other engineers on the team

What's In It for You

- Opportunity to work for a recognized Cisco Gold Partner that values collaboration and an entrepreneurial spirit
- Competitive base salary, bonuses, full benefits, 401K and vacation time.
- Paid training in additional Cisco Advanced Technologies (Security, IPT, Video, etc.)Please apply today or you can send your resume to me directly at:

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

items.title: Solutions Architect - Remote - £35-55kpa
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Solutions Architect - Mansfield (Remote)

Capita Intelligent Communications are currently looking for a Solutions Architect to be remote based - there will be an expectation to travel to the Mansfield site on occasions.

Solutions Architect (SA) - Role

Support Capita Intelligent Communications (CIC) overall vision by working with CIC Senior Management, CIC CRM's, Capita Business Units and other relevant internal and external stakeholders to understand client / market requirements and assist in the creation, management, delivery and continual development of the overriding 'Solutions' strategy needed to meet these requirements.

This includes 'Inbound Services' - digital mailroom, invoice processing, back scanning and archive / retrieval services, EDMS, RPA and other critical business and document workflows and 'Outbound Services' - print and mail, hybrid mail, document design, multi-channel communication delivery, print management, web based / online solutions, EDMS, data services and marketing services.

It also includes the solution sets (tools, processes and services) needed to meet market needs and enable the achievement of core financial objectives - revenue and contribution.

Solutions Architect - Principle Accountabilities

To act as a customer-facing subject matter expert / analyst on the solution sets needed to meet client and market requirements for all CIC services
To assist in the development of the pre-sales tools and services needed to advance prospect / client opportunities through this critical stage of the sales cycle
To maintain a thorough understanding of market requirements and technology and assist in the development of services and solutions as they relate to the strategic direction of the business and its clients
To provide advice, support and guidance to Senior Management, CRM's and wider Capita business in pre-sales scenarios - including presentations / demonstrations to prospects and customers
Carry out assessments of customer communications / document production processes, technologies and legacy document process workflows - including requirements gathering and definition, due diligence and analysis
Hold the ownership of the solutions design aspects of the proposed solution
To map and document legacy business processes and articulate associated services and solution designs. This includes the drafting of visit assessments, project briefing documents, proposals, solution statements, specification documents, HLD's development briefs and other forms of written communication
To implement and configure CIC products and services at customer sites as a lead analyst
To actively contribute and support all aspects of the tender process and strategy for CIC and Capita Business Unit sales levels
Assist in the accurate completion of company sales governance processes
To liaise with the CIC's project management / development teams and external third parties (where required) on customer projects
To complete regular management and financial reports for all project work in line with business and personal objectives

Solutions Architect - Essential Experience/Skills/certification

Experience and / or knowledge in the outbound document outsourcing industry - including competitor landscape
Experience and / or knowledge of the inbound document outsourcing industry - including competitor landscape
Experience of requirements gathering, due diligence and business analysis activity
Experience working in and delivering digital / business transformation initiatives and programmes
Ability to work independently in the achievement of assigned targets
Exceptional organisational and planning skills
Exceptional written and verbal communications - with the ability to outline complex propositions in layman's terms
Ability to work on multiple projects at one time
Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
Strong interpersonal skills and the associated ability to interact with individuals at all levels within the organisation, clients, partners and suppliers
Strong technical capability to be able to detail technical requirements to IT, developers and other internal and external technical teams

Solutions Architect - Package

Salary: £35-55kpa + Car allowance or company car
33 Days Holiday (Including Bank Holidays)
Remote Working
Travel Expenses
Pension
Childcare Vouchers
Cycle to Work
Medical Cash Plan, Dental Plan
Additional Life Assurance, Spouse / Partner Assurance, Critical Illness Insurance, Group Income Protection
Discounted Dining Card
Vehicle Breakdown Cover
Gym Discounts

Solutions Architect

If you are looking to join a brand-new team with exciting prospects and an actual career with progression, this could be for you! Send over your CV for immediate consideration.

Capita IT Resourcing is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

items.title: Azure Solution Architect - South East (Remote) - Up to 100k
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=30, c=2, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=26, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Azure Architect / Consultant - Up to 100k - South East

Do you like adverts that ask you questions at the start? This could be the perfect job for you..

Are you an experienced /.net consultant looking to expand your knowledge of Azure?

Are you an ambitious individual looking to join an expanding innovative team?

Company:

-Aiming to be the leading data focused technology business in Europe and the way things are going you'd be silly to bet against them achieving that goal.

-Currently leading the UK market in delivering Microsoft Azure based data platforms with their data science team at the cutting edge of delivering machine and deep learning solutions.

-Average annual growth is currently over 50%.

-Microsoft Gold Partner, in a position were they can turn down projects that dont excite them or offer something different due to sucess

Role:

75% remote working. You will only be on site 1 day a week at any of the client sites spread across the South.

You will be tasked with designing and building solutions using technologies such as:

Azure Web Apps, Azure Event Hubs, Azure Functions, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Service Bus, Azure SQL Server, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Data Lake and Azure Stream Analytics.

The role will also include working alongside the Data Science Practice where you will be assisting in the development of real time predictive analytical solutions that consist of technologies such as Microsoft Azure ML and 'R'.

You will bring a majority of the following experience:

Significant experience in delivering C# .Net solutions
An understanding of version control using Git repositories
Proven experience delivering Web APIs on Azure.
Business facing skills and a proven consultative approach.
Business analysis skills and experience of delivering discovery sessions with clients.
Good understanding of application life cycle management ideally using Team Foundation Services or Azure DevOps

These roles don't stay available for long so don't miss out and apply today!

Call (phone number removed) or email (url removed) for more info

Please Note: My clients do not offer sponsorship. You must be eligible to work in the UK

items.title: Azure Stack Cloud Solutions Architect-Remote (SR1157)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=16, frontend=0}
items.content:
Description

SAIC is hiring for an Azure or Azure Stack Cloud Solutions Architect to join and contribute to the Private Cloud team. This position is a combination of IT architecture and automation roles.

The Cloud department provides public and private cloud services, automation services, and tools to enable self service delivery of IT using the DevOps framework. This department will constantly evolve to meet the rapid pace of cloud innovation.



The successful candidate will have the following responsibilities:

  • Performs the full lifecycle management (analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, integration and maintenance) of the current Azure Stack cloud as well as contribute with architecture, procurement, deployment, production, and administration of additional scale units, availability zones, and disconnected deployments of Azure Stack.
  • Maintains the integrity of the stack and underlying systems and resource providers.
  • Build and maintain terraform Infrastructure as Code packages for cloud deployments. Build and maintain custom ARM templates.
  • Build and maintained CI/CD pipelines for IaaS deployments including such architectures as basic two-tier configurations to multi-node Horton Works Data Platform clusters.
  • Build Ansible playbooks for controlled IaaS systems.
  • Build complex powershell scripts to automate any number of configurations and scenarios.

The selected candidate must be able to solve new and complex problems involving the integration of a wide variety of technologies including servers, storage, networking, software, middleware and all systems supporting the private cloud environments. The selected candidate can work at a remote location but will be required to travel to Albuquerque throughout the year.


DISL

ABQS







Qualifications

Required Skills

  • Requires bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or information systems and 5 years of relevant work experience OR 9 years of relevant work experience in lieu of degree; Or Master's degree and 3 years of relevant work experience; OR PhD and no related experience.
  • Excellent communication and teaming skills.
  • Ability to obtain, and maintain, a DOE security clearance
  • Minimum of 2 years using one of the following technologies:
    • Azure
    • Azure Stack
    • AWS
    • Ansible
    • Terraform



Desired Skills

  • Experience building Azure Arm Templates
  • Experience building terraform packages
  • Experience with Gitlab Ci/CD
  • Windows Systems Administration (Windows 2012R2, 2016, 2019)
  • Linux Systems Administration (Ubuntu, RHEL)
  • Advanced PowerShell scripting
  • Microsoft Azure Certifications



Desired Qualifications



Job Posting Date: 2019-08-:21:32 UTC

Primary Location: ALBUQUERQUE, NM 87123 US

Clearance Level Must Currently Possess: None

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOE Q

Potential for Teleworking: No

Travel: No

Shift: Day Job

Schedule:
SAIC is a premier technology integrator, solving our nation's most complex modernization and systems engineering challenges across the defense, space, federal civilian, and intelligence markets. Our robust portfolio of offerings includes high-end solutions in systems engineering and integration; enterprise IT, including cloud services; cyber; software; advanced analytics and simulation; and training. We are a team of 23,000 strong driven by mission, united purpose, and inspired by opportunity. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $6.5 billion. For more information, visit saic.com. For information on the benefits SAIC offers, see Working at SAIC . EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability
- provided by Dice

items.title: Wellness Solutions Consultant
items.content:
Wellness Solutions Consultant at Peerfit

Remote
  • Wellness Solutions
  • United States

Interested in working for a team of people completely redefining how fitness and health care work together? At Peerfit, were flipping wellness reimbursements on their head by connecting insurers and employers wellness dollars to popular fitness studios offering CrossFit, yoga, barre, boot camp, cycling, and more. And, with our recent expansion into the Medicare Advantage space, we can now bring this benefit to everyone no matter their age. If working with a team of innovative and driven people who are modernizing how people engage with wellness excites you, look no further than Peerfit.

Position Summary:

The Wellness Solutions Consultants mission is to build out new networks of studios and gyms across the United States while developing lasting relationships along the way. He/she/they will be assigned the top places to workout in key cities and regions by creating relationships with studios owners & local fitness leaders as well as educate them on how Peerfits flexible fitness currency will make a positive impact. This is largely accomplished through outbound sales efforts including calls and emails.

Responsibilities:

  • Achieve Peerfit sales and revenue goals by acquiring new studios and gyms to the Peerfit wellness network
  • Utilize advanced consultative selling skills to identify and obtain new accounts and drive the growth of Peerfit.
  • Outbound sales efforts resulting in 75+ calls and/or 2.5 hours per day
  • Track all communications through Peerfit provided CRM
  • Acquire all necessary information to onboard new wellness partners so Peerfitters can utilize their studio/gym
  • Comfortable cold calling and emailing future partners to sell the concept of Peerfit
  • Ensure continuous update of knowledge and understanding of Peerfit’s strategies, capabilities, products, and services

Experience/Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of sales experience with the majority of this coming from remote work
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and collaboration skills with exceptional ability to establish and maintain effective external and internal relationships in a remote organization
  • Experience working with a CRM

GOOD TO HAVES:

  • Cold call experience
  • Knowledge of health, wellness, fitness and insurance industry and multi-state account expertise
  • Remote working experience
  • Experience with Base CRM/Zendesk Sell
  • Experience with scheduling platform Mindbody

WHAT YOU GET:

  • The opportunity to single handedly build the reach of peerfit across the United States and the world?
  • The chance to work in a relaxed yet goal driven start-up culture with a passion for fitness
  • The chance to be a part of a motivated, high energy and fun culture
  • Peerfit credits to attend fitness classes

Peerfit is an equal opportunity employer.

Apply for job

items.content:
Stratacent is all about delivering world-class IT solutions that are perfectly aligned to client needs, no matter how complex they may be. We are highly focused on our customers and our primary goal is to exceed expectations with every client who partners with us, with solutions that are innovative, practical and versatile enough to take their business to the next level. We follow the highest standards of professional ethics, delivering quality on time every time. Across every project, we strive to deliver reliable, scalable and agile solutions to clients technology needs integrating our core values of excellence, commitment, collaboration and creativity. Our offsite development center is located at 101 Hudson Street, Jersey City, NJ a building covering 1.25 million square feet of space in a Class A office tower 42 stories high, looming over the Hudson River/NYC Skyline and just 10 minutes from Wall Street in lower Manhattan.

Position Sr. AWS Architect

Location Cary, NC (Remote)

Technical Skills:

  • Familiarity with AWS products
  • Spinning up EC2 instances
  • Attaching AWS storage
  • Implementing firewall rules
  • Applying security groups
  • Applying hosts to AD groups
  • Hadoop knowledge is helpful
  • Remote is OK but the resource would be expected to work either Eastern Time hours or it may be possible to do work on Pacific Time as that matches with the client.

Employee Benefits

  • Premium Health Insurance
  • Premium Vision Plan
  • Premium Dental Plan
  • Short-Term Disability Plan
  • Long Term Disability Plan
  • Life Insurance
  • Paid Time Off
  • Continuous Learning Program

Stratacent is an equal opportunity employer. As such, to the extent defined by federal, state, and municipal law, Stratacent will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, age, sex, national origin, ancestry, handicap, or any other factor protected by law.

items.content: Job Posting Title: Infrastructure ArchitectLocation: Alpharetta - preferred or REMOTE (East Coast)Looking for an infrastructure solution architect with deep knowledge of Microsoft Azure (IaaS, PaaS and SaaS) Experience delivering infrastructure architectures for Azure-hosted enterprise-scale solutions Strong communication and consulting skills8+ years of experience working as a solutions architectExperience with Dell Boomi is a nice-to-have, but not a hard requirement given this is somewhat of a niche skillset.Ideally they're based in Alpharetta, GA, but we're open to candidates in other locations- preferably on the east coast/Remote--Position SummaryThe solution architect is a "thought-leader" and a "change agent" with strategic and tactical responsibilities.A Solution Architect is responsible for delivering solution designs and architectures for key global initiatives using COTS, MOTS and custom developed applications hosted in a variety of environments considering re-use, scalability and reliability. Oversees and sometimes leads the successful implementation of these designs and architectures by managing expectations and risks, ensuring appropriate organizational structures, principles, tools and responsibilities are in place Evaluates solutions to ensure that they are in alignment with the broader organization's mission, strategy / objectives, capabilities and processes using industry recognized architectural models and roadmaps Creates reliable solution plans that include cost estimates and optimized delivery approaches by working with the business and multi-disciplinary teams, enforcing governance and compliance activities for the solution Acts as a bridge between technical and business audiences during solution planning, development and deployment Works with the business to understand and solve complex problems, by presenting various solution options and technical concepts in a comprehensible manner.Experience/Required Skills: To qualify, candidates must have:Approximately 8-10 years of experience in information systems architecture methodologies, management, and tracking/analyzing budgetsExtensive knowledge of systems architectureExcellent management, interpersonal, communication, consultative, and organizational skillsSound judgment and tactStrong analytical abilityThe ability to work and team effectively with clients, management, and its staff membersOperating Systems - Experience in designing on MS Windows Server technologies , Unix, Linux and virtualization (VMWare)4-6yrs Databases - Experience in designing infrastructure for databases, e.g., high availability, D/R solutions around databases Oracle, MS SQL etc 4-6yrsSystems Management - Knowledge of enterprise class network and server management solutions such as HP Openview. 4-6yrs Internet Technologies - Web servers (IIS, Apache), Proxy servers, Load balancers, Global site selector, Firewalls, Certificate, SSO (Kerberos, ADFS, CA SiteMinder) etc. 4-6yrsDirectory Services - LDAP/AD/ADAM] 4-6yrsApplication servers - Tomcat, Websphere, Weblogic, Peoplesoft, Exchange, Lync, Microsoft Sharepoint, eRoom etc 4-6yrsNetwork and Security -Knowledge of enterprise class LAN (Office LAN, Data Center LAN), WAN, VPN and network security (IPSec, Firewalls, DMZ).General awareness of information security. 4-6yrsHardware - Basic knowledge of Dell and HP rack mounted servers, blades, HPUX, Superdome etc 4-6yrsStorage and Backup - Experience in designing solutions for managing enterprise class storage network solutions around technologies like SAN, NAS, Encrypting file system and products like EMC and NetApp storage devices.4-6yrs Capacity and performance - tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=16, frontend=0}
items.content:
Description

SAIC is hiring for an Azure or Azure Stack Cloud Solutions Architect to join and contribute to the Private Cloud team. This position is a combination of IT architecture and automation roles.

The Cloud department provides public and private cloud services, automation services, and tools to enable self service delivery of IT using the DevOps framework. This department will constantly evolve to meet the rapid pace of cloud innovation.



The successful candidate will have the following responsibilities:

  • Performs the full lifecycle management (analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, integration and maintenance) of the current Azure Stack cloud as well as contribute with architecture, procurement, deployment, production, and administration of additional scale units, availability zones, and disconnected deployments of Azure Stack.
  • Maintains the integrity of the stack and underlying systems and resource providers.
  • Build and maintain terraform Infrastructure as Code packages for cloud deployments. Build and maintain custom ARM templates.
  • Build and maintained CI/CD pipelines for IaaS deployments including such architectures as basic two-tier configurations to multi-node Horton Works Data Platform clusters.
  • Build Ansible playbooks for controlled IaaS systems.
  • Build complex powershell scripts to automate any number of configurations and scenarios.

The selected candidate must be able to solve new and complex problems involving the integration of a wide variety of technologies including servers, storage, networking, software, middleware and all systems supporting the private cloud environments. The selected candidate can work at a remote location but will be required to travel to Albuquerque throughout the year.


DISL

ABQS







Qualifications

Required Skills

  • Requires bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or information systems and 5 years of relevant work experience OR 9 years of relevant work experience in lieu of degree; Or Master's degree and 3 years of relevant work experience; OR PhD and no related experience.
  • Excellent communication and teaming skills.
  • Ability to obtain, and maintain, a DOE security clearance
  • Minimum of 2 years using one of the following technologies:
    • Azure
    • Azure Stack
    • AWS
    • Ansible
    • Terraform



Desired Skills

  • Experience building Azure Arm Templates
  • Experience building terraform packages
  • Experience with Gitlab Ci/CD
  • Windows Systems Administration (Windows 2012R2, 2016, 2019)
  • Linux Systems Administration (Ubuntu, RHEL)
  • Advanced PowerShell scripting
  • Microsoft Azure Certifications



Desired Qualifications



Job Posting Date: 2019-08-:21:32 UTC

Primary Location: ALBUQUERQUE, NM 87123 US

Clearance Level Must Currently Possess: None

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOE Q

Potential for Teleworking: No

Travel: No

Shift: Day Job

Schedule:
SAIC is a premier technology integrator, solving our nation's most complex modernization and systems engineering challenges across the defense, space, federal civilian, and intelligence markets. Our robust portfolio of offerings includes high-end solutions in systems engineering and integration; enterprise IT, including cloud services; cyber; software; advanced analytics and simulation; and training. We are a team of 23,000 strong driven by mission, united purpose, and inspired by opportunity. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $6.5 billion. For more information, visit saic.com. For information on the benefits SAIC offers, see Working at SAIC . EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability
- provided by Dice

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=24, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Java Solution Architect (m/w/d) (REMOTE – Deutschlandweit) // camunda

Company: camunda

Tags:
  • Java
  • German
  • Software
  • Training
  • Architect
  • Solution
  • Softwarentwicklung
  • Practices

    • BESCHREIBUNG

    Camunda ist eines der am schnellsten wachsenden Unternehmen in Europa. Wir sind ein über 120 Mitarbeiter starkes, internationales Team mit Hauptsitz in Berlin und Büros in San Francisco und Denver. Wir bieten eine innovative Open Source-Plattform, mit der wir Unternehmen dabei helfen, ihre Geschäftsprozesse zu automatisieren. Als leichtgewichtiges Framework kann Camunda dabei sehr einfach in bestehende Tech-Stacks integriert werden, sowohl in jedes Java-basiertes Universum wie Spring Boot oder Jakarta EE, als auch in jede andere Sprachumgebung wie Node JS, .Net oder Python.

    Mit diesem Angebot sind wir sehr erfolgreich. Mittlerweile nutzen mehr als 250 Kunden unsere Lösung, darunter Unternehmen wie AT&T, 24 Hour Fitness, Zalando, T-Mobile und Universal. Neben dieser innovativen Technologie ist unsere große Expertise und Praxiserfahrung im Bereich der Workflowautomatisierung und moderner Softwareentwicklungs-Technologien im Allgemeinen ein weiteres wesentliches Element, warum sich Unternehmen für Camunda entscheiden. Als technischer Experte für Camunda bist Du daher eine zentrale Schlüsselperson, um den Erfolg unserer Kunden und von Camunda weiter auszubauen.

    DEINE TÄTIGKEITEN:

    Du unterstützt unsere Kunden als technischer Experte in allen Lebenslagen, von der Evaluation von Camunda bis zum Roll-out des finalen Projektes:

    • Du präsentierst Produkt-Demos, beantwortest technische Fragen und hilfst Organisationen bei der Evaluation von Camunda
    • Du implementierst Proof of Concepts zusammen mit Softwarentwicklern, IT-Architekten und Fachabteilungen des Kunden und zeigst ihnen, wie sie ihre Geschäftsprozesse mit Camunda und der Technologie ihrer Wahl erfolgreich automatisieren
    • Du berätst Kunden dabei, Camunda optimal in Ihre bestehende IT-Architektur zu integrieren
    • Du führst Trainings durch und vermittelst technisches Wissen über Einsatzbereiche und die Verwendung von Camunda
    • Du führst Reviews von automatisierten Prozessen durch und zeigst Kunden Verbesserungspotentiale auf
    • In der Zeit in der Du nicht vor Ort bei Kunden bist (ca. 50% Deiner Arbeitszeit), baust Du Showcases, probierst neue Technologien aus und erstellst neue Trainingsunterlagen und Best Practices
    • Bei Interesse kannst Du gerne Blogposts und Whitepaper veröffentlichen, mit unserer sehr aktiven Open Source Community kommunizieren oder Talks auf Konferenzen halten.

    WEN WIR SUCHEN:

    • Du hast einen Hochschulabschluss im Bereich (Wirtschafts-)informatik oder ähnlichen Studiengängen
    • Dein Herz schlägt für Softwareentwicklung! Du hast mindestens 3 Jahre Software in einem professionellen Kontext entwickelt (idealerweise in Java) und hast in diesen Projekten aktuelle Tools, Frameworks und Methoden eingesetzt
    • Du hast Freude daran, mit Menschen zu interagieren, Workshops oder Trainings zu leiten und als technischer Experte im Mittelpunkt zu stehen
    • Dir fällt es leicht, komplexe Sachverhalte schnell zu verstehen und sie verständlich zu erklären
    • Als Solution Architect bist Du häufig vor Ort bei unseren Kunden (ca. 50% Deiner Zeit), d.h. Du magst es zu reisen, sowohl innerhalb Deutschlands als auch international
    • Du beherrschst Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift sicher

    DEIN ARBEITSORT:

    Camunda begreift sich als verteilte Organisation – für uns ist es nicht entscheidend, von welchem Ort aus Du arbeitest. Viel wichtiger ist es uns, mit herausragenden Talenten zusammenzuarbeiten, die ihrer Tätigkeit mit Leidenschaft, Spaß und Begeisterung nachgehen. Daher kannst Du Deinen Arbeitsort frei wählen. Da Du regelmäßig reisen wirst, ist es jedoch wichtig, dass ein Bahnhof und ein Flughafen für Dich in erreichbarer Nähe sind.

    WAS WIR DIR BIETEN:

    • Wir sind ein schnell wachsendes, profitables und stabiles Startup mit einer Glassdoor-Bewertung von 4,9
    • Bei uns gibt es keine Vollzeit-Projekteinsätze. Stattdessen bieten wir Dir kurzweilige Einsätze (zw. 1 bis 4 Tagen) bei spannenden Unternehmen sowie ausreichend Zeit um Dich in neue Technologien einzuarbeiten und mit unserer Community zu kommunizieren – Abwechslung garantiert!
    • Eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten in einem interationalen und hochmotivierten Team
    • Flexible Arbeitsbedingungen und die Möglichkeit, von zu Hause aus zu arbeiten.
    • Wahlfreiheit bei Deiner technischen Ausstattung, z.B. Mac oder Linux oder Windows
    • Kostenloser Sportvereinspass und Englischunterricht
    • In unserem Büro in Berlin: freie Getränke, Obst, Cerealien, Snacks, Eis und Bier (natürlich selbst gebraut).

    Camunda ist ein Arbeitgeber mit Chancengleichheit für alle – wir schätzen Vielfalt in unserem Unternehmen.

    Apply for this position

items.title: Cloud Solutions Architect
items.content:
Cloud Solutions Architect

United States, California
Company: CyberCoders

Overview

Minimum Required Skills:
Cisco, AWS, Azure, GCP, Cloud Solutions Design

National Technology Solutions Provider is in growth mode and currently has 2 open positions for Cloud focused Solutions Architects. Skills in any 2 or more of the following areas is sought:

– Cloud Security
– Data Center Cloud Solutions Engineering
– Network Cloud Automation

These are Enterprise Architect level Cloud SA roles where you will have the opportunity to integrate business strategy and processes of an organization to its IT strategy. The partnerships with leading edge technology manufacturers to include Cisco, VMware, Amazon, Microsoft and Google – allow us to be versatile and deliver client specific solutions that are in their best interest.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

– Strategic and highly visible role within a leading Tech Solutions Provider
– Excellent comp plan offered to highly qualified candidates
– Brand name, Fortune 100 client list
– Work remotely from home when not in front of clients

What You Will Be Doing

– Support several Account Executives by providing technical leadership in helping customers design and architect complex multi-technology solutions.
– Work with key business stakeholders and subject matter experts to build a holistic view of their client’s technology and digital transformation strategy.
– Develop and finalize solution architecture/design and detailed line item configurations and/or bill-of-materials (BOMs)
– Develop and finalize solution proposal and/or presentation of recommended solutions
– Complete and author technical sections for RFP/RFI/RFQ responses
– Function as primary interface for customer technical staff regarding proposed solution and its design, configuration, implementation, and testing specifics
– Function as technical liaison with field OEM channel sales and technical teams
– Conduct knowledge transfers with colleagues and service delivery team regarding solution and OEM product updates/changes, lessons learned from previous engagements/experience, etc.
– Assist sales team in dealing with customer satisfaction issues surrounding technical aspects or approach of a recommended solution

What You Need for this Position

– Strong Pre Sales / Solutions Architecture expertise in the Cloud arena
– Strong Cloud Networking, Cloud Data Center, Cloud Security and / or Network Cloud Automation expertise
– Solid AWS, Azure and Google Cloud solutions design / architecture abilities
– Solid experience in Networking Methodologies, including Software Defined Networking, Network Security, Mobility, Cloud Connectivity, Network Segmentation, Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity Planning
– Solid backgound in: Network Engineering (R/S, Wireless, Security), Network Architecture and Design (MPLS/OTV/VPN), Identity Services Management (ClearPass/ISE), Cloud Networking (AWS/Azure/GCP), Cloud Security and Cloud XaaS Services, Virtualization
– Excellent client engagement expertise
– Strong attention-to-detail and customer satisfaction

What’s In It for You

Strong overall compensation plan to include:

– Vacation/PTO
– Medical
– Dental
– Vision
– Bonus
– 401k
– remote from home when not in front of clientsNetwork Cloud Solutions Architects with strong AWS/Azure/GCP expertise please apply ASAP or you can send your resume to me directly:

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking ‘Click Here to Apply’ with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

– Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

CyberCoders will consider for Employment in the City of Los Angeles qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box) Ordinance.
